Recap: Webster's testimony is damaged when Jeffrey puts Gus on the stand and shows him a picture taken of him and Webster in the parking garage the night before. Jeffrey also reveals that Gus knew Webster in Chicago. Moreover, Webster is schooled in beating lie detector tests. Gus tells Harley that he set it all up. He knew they were losing the case, and he had to do something. Gus wants to rest the case, but Harley refuses to let him. She wants to take the stand. Edmund gives Dinah her first fertility shot. Dinah has a nightmare about Edmund taking the baby away from her. She shows up to Edmund's claiming she is sick, and he jumps at the chance to take care of her. Beth apologizes to Edmund for being so hard on him when they were together. She now understands how a person can have such extreme reactions, as she did with Phillip. Edmund calls Cassie and asks her to come home. Tammy, Sandy, and Marina talk about the trial and the "good news" that is supposed to come. Tammy vows that she is turning over a new leaf and that she wants more control. This will start with her finding a new place to live. Beth and Sebastian meet and sparks fly. Holly tells Sebastian that she wants to write a story about his starting over. He agrees to let her, only if she helps him with information about Spaulding. Bill discovers the picture of Webster and Gus on Olivia's cell phone and confronts her. Rick vows to never forgive Beth for her betrayal.

Beth: I wasn't thinking. I...

Gus: Chicago.

Gus: Objection, judge.
Judge: Overruled.
Jeffrey: You tried to pull one over on us, didn't you? But it didn't work.
Gus: Oh, objection. Argumentative.
Jeffrey: I withdraw. You're excused.
Harley: Oh, god, it's true. Everything he said is true.

Sebastian: Yes.

Sebastian: Hm?

Dinah: Pleasure. You can call me dinah.

Edmund: Because louise is much more helpful and efficient.

Dinah: Overjoyed.

Sebastian: What's in it for me, holly?
Holly: What do you want?
Sebastian: Hm. How about... how about a little assistance?
Holly: You want dirt on the spauldings.
Sebastian: Mm, not dirt. Maybe just a little info. You know, when you're dealing with people, it's always helpful to know what's kind of lurking right beneath the surface.
Holly: Yes, yes. It certainly is.
Dinah: Louise, this looks like a spreadsheet of maternity stores.
Louise: I figured out minutes per store based on square footage.
Dinah: Not much of a shopper, are you, louise?
Louise: The car is waiting outside.
Dinah: Whoa, whoa, whoa. Hold on for a moment. Louise, this is great. You've really put a lot of thought into this, but I am just going to take it easy today. I'm not really feeling up for it.
Louise: But when ambassador winslow schedules an appointment...
Dinah: I'll be sure to tell mr. Winslow that I'm not an appoinent. But thank you for all of your time and your computer expertise. But I'm going to take it easy today and just... just have a rest.
Louise: Fine. We'll reschedule.
Dinah: Good. Yeah. Absolutely. I'll call you.

Dinah: Hi. Hi, there. You are more beautiful than i thought you'd be. Hi. Look at the little hands. Look at the little feet. Hi, darling. You know, you are the best part of me. You're the most perfect thing in my life, the only good thing in my life. Huh? I never felt so connected, so loved, and so needed. You need mommy, don't you? Yes, you do.

Edmund: Ah, there she is. Dinah. These are my lawyers, james and john. Pursuant to article 21, line seven of our contract, said baby is to be delivered precisely at 12:00 noon to its biological parents, edmund and cassandra winslow. John?
Dinah: Edmund? He hasn't eaten yet.
Edmund: We want to thank you for doing service to the winslow family, and present you with a small token of our appreciation. James? Note the inscription.
Dinah: A clock? Edmund, I don't want a clock.
Edmund: We enjoyed doing business with you. Ciao.
Dinah: Edmund! You don't take my baby away from me!
Sandy: This place is awesome. I'm moving in.
Tammy: I knew you would love it.
Sandy: It's so perfect. A tree house in the middle of town.

Tammy: The cooper family diner used to be right over there. Frank and harley grew up in the apartment above the restaurant. But marina told me they always wished that they could have grown up in a house, so frank built this for harley. It's still their secret hideaway.
Sandy: Hm. That's a good story.
Tammy: I like small spaces. When I was a kid, I used to like to build these forts out of chairs and tablecloths, or hide in closets. Small spaces make you feel protected.
Sandy: It must have been tough to move to that big palace in san cristobel, then.
Tammy: Well, it was. I asked them if I could have a small room, and richard laughed at me. But he did find me the smallest room in the palace.
Sandy: He sounds like a cool dad. Was he?
Tammy: The best. He was the first guy to ever really make my mom and me feel safe. é@
Tammy: I feel safe now, up here with you.
Beth: Hey.
Edmund: Hi, beth. Beth! Hello. How are you? Sorry. Lizzie? James?
Beth: They're fine.
Edmund: Good.
Beth: You're meeting cassie?
Edmund: No. Cassie's out of town.
Beth: I owe you an apology.
Edmund: An apology? For what?
Beth: When we were together, I was... I was pretty hard on you. Unforgiving.
Edmund: Well, there seems to be a lot of that going around these days.

Beth: You just... you know, you were so extreme in your reactions, so reckless, and i never understood that until now. When phillip took james, I lost it. And I would have done anything, and I do mean anything, to get him back.
Edmund: I understand.
Beth: I knew you would. I just... I love my kids, and i couldn't imagine my life without them.
Edmund: I can't imagine mineÑi without cassie.
Beth: You two have something very special together.
Edmund: If I lose her, I lose everything.
Beth: Lose her? Edmund, you and cassie aren't having problems, are you?
Edmund: No. No. I just... I miss her. Well, not problems I can't handle, at any rate...
Beth: "Handle"? Edmund, you... ( laughs ) that's funny.
Edmund: What?
Beth: No, I was just... I was just about to tell you not to do anything rash, but who am I to tell someone not to go too far? No. When it comes to love, the rules are meant to be broken.
Harley: You be straight with me. Is jeffrey telling the truth about jack webster? Did you arrest him in chicago? Did you set this up?
Gus: We were losing the case.
Harley: Just answer the question.
Gus: I'm not letting you go down for a murder you didn't commit.
Harley: Oh, my... oh, my god.

Gus: I remembered jack webster, and I knew exactly what would happen if he took a lie detector test. I remember because I recruited him. It was the only way that I could save you. Listen to me. You can be angry at me or hate me or whatever, but we were losing this case and we are still standing now. We're still standing because of webster. We have a chance now because of webster. We have a chance.
Harley: Do we?

Gus: Absolutely. Absolutely. O'neill, he did his little dog- and-pony show, but he couldn't even connect the dots. Your case is purely circumstantial. Do you understand me? We're going to beat this thing.
Bailiff: The judge wants to speak with you.
Gus: Just hang tough, okay?
Buzz: What did he say?
Frank: Harley, is it true? Sis?
Harley: I... I don't know. I don't know.
Alan: Shocking, isn't it, that gus would pull something like this?
Bill: Maybe it's o'neill pulling a fast one.

Alan: I don't know about that, bill. The evidence speaks pretty well for itself-- I mean, especially that photo of webster and gus taken in the garage. What I don't understand is how he could obtain something like that.
Olivia: Excuse me.
Frank: I should have seen this coming. I should have done a background check. I should have asked the guy more questions. Hell, I'm the one that brought him in the courtroom, dad.
Buzz: You wanted it to be true. We all wanted it to be true. Maybe it is true. I mean, it's all smoke and mirrors in there. Maybe... where did this picture come from? ( Cell phone rings )
Frank: Gus is up to his eyeballs in this. Did you see his face, dad? He's guilty as hell.
Buzz: Jeffrey put separate facts up there. They don't necessarily add up, do they? They don't, frank. He must have said something.
Harley: He said to hang in there. That's what I'm going to do.
Edmund: All right. I'll get you some water. I'll put you down here.
Dinah: Thank you.
Edmund: Just lie back. Let me take care of you dinah, all right?
Dinah: Okay.
Edmund: All right.
Marina: Hey. So did you solve all your problems yet?
Tammy: I hope you don't mind...
Marina: Mind? I'm the one who told you to come up here if you ever needed to get a clearer view of things.
Sandy: Well, if it's okay with the coopers, I'm moving in.
Marina: Oh, great. Family party.
Tammy: So did you hear anything at court?
Marina: I just left some messages. I decided to come over here and wait for the good news. The way I see it, everything is going to be okay.
Sandy: Yeah. Tammy will find a new home...
Tammy: ...And harley will come home.
Marina: It's all good.
Bill: You want to tell me what that is?
Olivia: I... um...
Bill: Never mind. I'll tell you what it is. That is my wife trying to nail harley cooper to the wall.
Frank: What's taking so damn long?
Buzz: Well, I hope gus is calling some evidence into question.
Frank: What are you talking about? He just admitted to meeting that guy. How can you call that into question?
Buzz: Oh, frank, come on. We're going to know in a few minutes. Give it a rest. Don't jump to conclusions.

Frank: Really? Well, you know what? Harley wouldn't be in this courtroom if it wasn't for that bogus witness. Dad, she already agreed to cop a plea deal so she wouldn't have to spend the rest of her life in prison.
Buzz: Frank!
Frank: Gus just took care of that.
Buzz: Don't go there now. Honey, can I get you anything? Some water?

Gus: Come here. Listen. We're going to gamble that webster's testimony made a bigger impression on the jury than o'neill's file and picture show, okay? So I just told the judge that we're resting the case.
Harley: You can't rest the case. Not until you put me on the stand.

Harley: Yes.
Bill: What are you talking about? What does alan even have on you to begin with?
